result.title: Project website and social media
result.description: A project website will be developped and centralize all relevant information related to the project ; it will serve as a communication tool not only for the stakeholders, but also with all the members of the ecosystems involved in the project. It will be operational at the end of the third month of the project. The website will be centered on the developed identity, will present the progress of the project and will also contain relevant information for the target groups. The website will also provide links to the events and activities planned during the project and all the initiatives and projects within the European start-up ecosystem relevant for the stakeholders. It will integrate the presentation of the project, its funding scheme and the consortium members, including contact details, the agenda of the events organized by the consortium and also relevant events taking place in the different ecosystems, the start-ups portfolio, the collaboration proposals and the finance opportunities. All the members of the consortium will contribute to update the website for each events organized in the different countries.

result.title: Field test evaluation in Netherlands trials: Results and best practice
result.description: - Motorcycle couriers: DynaHUBs will integrate with the scheduled and unscheduled delivery orders of motorcycle couriers in order feed into its core scheduling system. Later, integrating those with delivery orders from other sources, DynaHUBs will live update the courier delivery schedules. We will also mitigate the possible lack of systems to integrate at couriers. We anticipate some couriers not having scheduling systems, rather running at the operator level. - Groceries: We will seek to integrate (at least at the test level) the time-scheduled delivery orders in Groceries. - E-commerce vendors: Similar to Groceries, we will also integrate with e-commerce vendors. We may start with e-commerce vendors given their flexibility in delivery time-windows.

project.title: DynaHUBs is a new application designed to kick start the development of the Physical Internet using a crowd-sourced approach

result.title: Methodology for the horizontal and vertical analysis of the value chain
result.description: This deliverable consists of putting in place/adopting a relevant methodology to analyze the value chain, taking into account the characteristics of the players targeted in the project, their development strategies, the diversity of technological bricks in the emerging field of “Internet of Things” and the specificities of the 4 applicative domains in the scope of the project. It will be necessary to identify the specific distinctions of the different themes chosen by each hub while keeping a common framework for the analysis. The analysis will be two-fold: it will integrate both horizontal and vertical components, taking into account key elements of the value chain and the activity sectors. Furthermore, task leaders will pay particular attention to integrate elements allowing to analyze the specific characteristics of the value chain in each country. The methodology will have to put forward in an efficient way alliance and business opportunities according to the know-how and the solutions of the start-ups associated to the targeted ecosystems, but also, if necessary, in the larger European start-up ecosystem.

result.title: Action plan and recommendations based on the mapping of the innovation landscape and remaining obstacles
result.description: An action plan will be developed based on the updated mapping which will be communicated to policy makers and other stakeholders. The action plan will provide an overview of current framework conditions, identify obstacles in forming innovation partnerships at various levels (single actors, organisations, governmental departments, etc), and propose solutions towards alleviating this obstacles along with the responsible stakeholder that needs to uptake action.

result.title: Macro estimates of intangibles cyber-risks
result.description: This deliverable will conduct macroeconomic estimates providing data for cyber-security markets for EU as well as leading OECD countries. An elaboration of a potential index for cyber-security will also be explored. Finally, for the supply side, the volume of the cyber-security market for suppliers – especially at EU level – will be estimated.

result.title: Second release of EUth-systems
result.description:
Deliverable 2.3 encompasses the deployment of further 2-3 compontents and APPS in the toolkit EUth-applications. The software applications are developed and designed according to the requirements identified in the design workshops during the second iterative cycle. The browser-based user interface for the applications is finalized and enables the testing of the applications on different devices, that is desktop computers, laptops or smartphones. The back-end and front-end components will be optimized in the following (third) iterative cycle.
Additionally, D 2.3 consists of a new release of the optimized first 2-3 compontents of deliverable 2.2.
